Description: Blue-green glazed composition spacer-bead in openwork design with seven perforations in the base and top for threading. The faces show intricate decoration of religious scenes. One side has a design showing a falcon wearing the double crown, flanked by a pair of winged cobras, with an additional cobra at each edge. The reverse shows Horus the Child on a nwb-hieroglyph with winged cobras behind and in front. On the far right is a figure of a falcon-headed god wearing the double crown, presenting two bound captives.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2006 Oct-Feb, Houston Museum of Natural Sciences, Mummy: The Inside Story 2006 7 Mar-6 Aug, Mobile (Alabama), Gulf Coast Exploreum Science Center, Mummy: The Inside Story 2006-2007 6 Oct-18 Feb, Tokyo, National Museum of Nature and Science, Mummy: The Inside Story 2007 17 Mar-17 Jun, Kobe City Museum, Mummy: The Inside Story
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Thomas David Gibson Carmichael, 1st Baron Carmichael
